Step1.content: three and a half ounces of smoky bacon half a pound of ground beef half a pound of ground pork one onion a stalk of celery and one carrot two tablespoons of tomato paste three tablespoons of olive oil three and a half tablespoons of butter one glass of whole milk one glass of red wine and a cup of beef stock and some pepper and salt spaghetti three and a half ounces for each serving
Step1.label: Preparation of Ingredients
Step1.step_assignment_explanation: This segment covers the initial step of gathering and preparing all the necessary ingredients for the recipe.

IngredientDetail.label: Ingredient Detail
IngredientDetail.explanation: The narration provides precise measurements and specifies the types of ingredients required, such as 'three and a half ounces of smoky bacon' and 'one glass of red wine', enabling accurate replication of the recipe.

CookingTechniqueExplanation.label: Cooking Technique Explanation
CookingTechniqueExplanation.explanation: The narration lists ingredients but does not elaborate on the cooking techniques to be used with these ingredients, assuming some level of preexisting knowledge or leaving room for interpretation.

PersonalizationEngagement.label: Personalization & Engagement
PersonalizationEngagement.explanation: This narration is straightforward and focuses solely on the ingredients list without incorporating personal anecdotes, expressions, or any form of personal engagement.

HealthNutritionFocus.label: Health & Nutrition Focus
HealthNutritionFocus.explanation: Health and nutrition are not explicitly addressed in the narration. The focus is on the recipe ingredients without mentioning their health aspects or nutritional values.

CulinaryStyle.label: Culinary Style
CulinaryStyle.explanation: The ingredients listed, such as smoky bacon, ground beef, and olive oil, suggest a traditional culinary style rather than an innovative or alternative approach to cooking.

Step2.content: the first thing to do for the Bolognese is to mince the onion the carrot and the celery in a large pot add the olive oil and the butter and to that add the vegetable mixture so tell you until soft and until just before it goes golden
Step2.label: Sautéing Vegetables
Step2.step_assignment_explanation: This segment describes mincing the vegetables and sautéing them in a mixture of olive oil and butter until they are soft but not yet golden.

IngredientDetail.label: Ingredient Detail
IngredientDetail.explanation: The narration provides a list of ingredients required for the Bolognese with some description of preparation (e.g., 'mince the onion, the carrot, and the celery') but does not specify quantities, making it moderately detailed.

CookingTechniqueExplanation.label: Cooking Technique Explanation
CookingTechniqueExplanation.explanation: The narration offers explicit instructions on how to cook the vegetable mixture ('so tell you until soft and until just before it goes golden'), providing viewers with clear guidance on the cooking technique.

Step3.content: now that the vegetables are cooked you can add the minced bacon and after that's got some color you can add the ground beef and the pork natural means of course the meats with the vegetables must be brown very well
Step3.label: Cooking Meats
Step3.step_assignment_explanation: Here, the narration moves on to adding the minced bacon to the sautéed vegetables, followed by the ground beef and pork, emphasizing the importance of browning the meat well.

CookingTechniqueExplanation.label: Cooking Technique Explanation

Step4.content: you can see the meat is well-cooked now you can add the glass of red wine and cook it into the wine is completely absorbed when the wine is cooked out and the meat is getting a bit dry you can add the tomato paste and you can pull this out with a bit of the beef stock rolled or in bacau broad stir it together add some salt and lower the heat
Step4.label: Adding Liquids and Seasonings
Step4.step_assignment_explanation: This part of the narration details the addition of red wine, allowing it to be absorbed completely, followed by tomato paste and beef stock to the well-browned meat, along with seasoning adjustments.

Step5.content: and now the regu must simmer continue cooking it on a very low heat for about an hour and a half and add the broth little by little as you cook to keep the meat moist

Step9.content: our spaghetti bolognese is ready if you'd like to give the genuine finishing touch sprinkle it with a bit of parmigiano Reggiano buon appetito from sonia and jealous affair on oh and we'll see you in the next video recipe

Step1.content: grind 500 grams of beef peel wash and fine dice 150 grams of onion 200 grams of carrots and 200 grams of celery stalks peel 500 grams of tomatoes use a sharp knife and make a crosswise incision place in boiling water for one minute and shock and ice water remove the skins and dice the tomatoes
Step1.label: Preparation of Ingredients
Step1.step_assignment_explanation: This segment describes the initial preparation of all the primary ingredients required for the lasagna, including meats and vegetables.

IngredientDetail.label: Ingredient Detail
IngredientDetail.explanation: The narration provides specific measurements for each ingredient, ensuring detailed guidance for ingredient preparation.

CookingTechniqueExplanation.label: Cooking Technique Explanation
CookingTechniqueExplanation.explanation: The narration includes explicit instructions on how to prepare the ingredients, such as grinding, peeling, dicing, and blanching tomatoes.

PersonalizationEngagement.label: Personalization & Engagement
PersonalizationEngagement.explanation: The narration focuses strictly on the recipe preparation without incorporating personal anecdotes or expressions.

HealthNutritionFocus.label: Health & Nutrition Focus
HealthNutritionFocus.explanation: There is no explicit mention of health or nutritional information or guidance in the narration.

CulinaryStyle.label: Culinary Style
CulinaryStyle.explanation: The cooking techniques and ingredients mentioned are in line with traditional cooking methods, without suggesting any innovative or alternative approaches.

Step2.content: heat 30 grams of oil and 60 grams of butter in a pan over medium heat add the onion and cook until translucent as the celery and the carrot and cook for a minute or two stirring occasionally
Step2.label: Sautéing Vegetables
Step2.step_assignment_explanation: Here, the diced onions, carrots, and celery are sautéed in a mixture of oil and butter until the onions become translucent, following the initial preparation.

IngredientDetail.label: Ingredient Detail
IngredientDetail.explanation: The narration provides specific measurements for both the oil and butter, as well as mentioning the specific vegetables to be used, indicating a high level of detail regarding ingredients.

CookingTechniqueExplanation.label: Cooking Technique Explanation
CookingTechniqueExplanation.explanation: The instructions on heating the oil and butter, followed by adding and cooking the onion until translucent, then the celery and carrot, are clear and step-by-step, showing an explicit explanation of cooking techniques.

PersonalizationEngagement.label: Personalization & Engagement
PersonalizationEngagement.explanation: The narration focuses solely on the cooking process without any personal anecdotes, expressions, or engaging elements, making it low in personalization and engagement.

HealthNutritionFocus.label: Health & Nutrition Focus
HealthNutritionFocus.explanation: There is no mention of health or nutritional considerations in the narration, indicating no focus on this aspect.

CulinaryStyle.label: Culinary Style
CulinaryStyle.explanation: The method of cooking described is a conventional approach to starting a base for many dishes (e.g., mirepoix with oil and butter), suggesting a traditional culinary style.

Step3.content: add the ground beef and season right away with two teaspoons of salt and half a teaspoon of ground black pepper cook stirring frequently until the meat changes its red color
Step3.label: Cooking Meats
Step3.step_assignment_explanation: In this part of the narration, the ground beef is added to the sautéed vegetables and seasoned, emphasizing the cooking process until the meat changes color.

IngredientDetail.label: Ingredient Detail
IngredientDetail.explanation: The narration provides some specific measurements for salt and pepper but does not detail other aspects like the type of ground beef (e.g., fat content), making it moderate in ingredient detail.

CookingTechniqueExplanation.label: Cooking Technique Explanation
CookingTechniqueExplanation.explanation: The narration offers clear, step-by-step instructions on how to cook the ground beef, including seasoning and the visual cue for doneness (changing color), qualifying it as explicit in technique explanation.

PersonalizationEngagement.label: Personalization & Engagement
PersonalizationEngagement.explanation: This narration lacks personal anecdotes, expressions, or any form of personal engagement, focusing purely on the cooking process.

HealthNutritionFocus.label: Health & Nutrition Focus
HealthNutritionFocus.explanation: There is no explicit mention of health or nutritional considerations in the choice of ingredients or cooking method.

CulinaryStyle.label: Culinary Style
CulinaryStyle.explanation: The method of cooking ground beef seasoned with salt and pepper is a traditional approach, common in many cuisines without any innovative or alternative techniques mentioned.

Step4.content: add 350 milliliters of milk and a pinch of nutmeg simmer until it evaporates add 250 milliliters of dry white wine and coke until it evaporates add the tomatoes and simmer over low heat for at least 3 hours stirring from time to time if the bolognaise dries out add half a cup of water or stock
Step4.label: Adding Liquids and Seasonings
Step4.step_assignment_explanation: This segment details the addition of milk, nutmeg, white wine, and tomatoes to the meat and vegetable mixture, including the simmering process and adjustments with additional liquid as needed.

IngredientDetail.label: Ingredient Detail
IngredientDetail.explanation: The narration provides specific measurements for the milk, nutmeg, dry white wine, and tomatoes, indicating a high level of detail regarding ingredient quantities.

CookingTechniqueExplanation.label: Cooking Technique Explanation
CookingTechniqueExplanation.explanation: The instructions on simmering until liquids evaporate, and the duration for simmering the tomatoes, show an explicit explanation of cooking techniques.

HealthNutritionFocus.label: Health & Nutrition Focus
HealthNutritionFocus.explanation: There is no explicit emphasis on health or nutrition within the provided narration, as it focuses solely on the cooking process.

CulinaryStyle.label: Culinary Style
CulinaryStyle.explanation: Simmering ingredients over low heat for extended periods is indicative of a traditional culinary style focused on developing flavors.

Step5.content: add the tomatoes and simmer over low heat for at least 3 hours stirring from time to time if the bolognaise dries out add half a cup of water or stock

Step6.content: set 200 grams of flour into the mixing bowl add a pinch of salt and two eggs mix on low speed until smooth and elastic finish kneading the dough on a lightly floured working surface gather into a bowl cover and let the dough relax for at least 40 minutes you can also mix the dough by hand
Step6.label: Preparation of Pasta
Step6.step_assignment_explanation: This part of the narration outlines the preparation of homemade pasta dough, from mixing the ingredients to letting the dough rest before rolling.

IngredientDetail.label: Ingredient Detail
IngredientDetail.explanation: The narration provides specific measurements for the flour, salt, and eggs, offering clear guidance on the quantities needed.

CulinaryStyle.explanation: Making dough from basic ingredients like flour, eggs, and salt follows a traditional culinary style without any innovative or alternative techniques mentioned.

Step7.content: roll the pasta into one millimeter thick rectangles bring four liters of water to boil and add four teaspoons of salt slip four sheets of pasta at a time cook for five seconds remove from the boiling water and drop into cold water spread on a towel and Pat it dry to assemble the lasagna brush a 13 by 30 centimeter pan with melted butter and spread a tablespoon of bechamel sauce line with a single layer of pasta sheets spread a thin layer of bechamel sauce spray a layer of bolognese sauce and sprinkle with grated Parmesan cheese repeat this process until there are eight layers of pasta
Step7.label: Combining with Pasta
Step7.step_assignment_explanation: This extensive segment details the process of combining the prepared pasta with the Bolognese and bechamel sauces to assemble the lasagna, from boiling the pasta sheets to layering the ingredients.

IngredientDetail.label: Ingredient Detail
IngredientDetail.explanation: The narration provides detailed specifications for ingredients, including the precise thickness of pasta and exact measurements for water and salt.

CookingTechniqueExplanation.explanation: The technique for rolling pasta, boiling it, and layering the lasagna is described in a step-by-step manner, allowing viewers to follow the process clearly.

PersonalizationEngagement.explanation: The narration focuses solely on instructional content without personal anecdotes or expressions, aiming for a straightforward instructional tone.

HealthNutritionFocus.label: Health & Nutrition Focus
HealthNutritionFocus.explanation: Health and nutrition are not explicitly addressed in the narration, with the focus instead on the preparation of the dish.

CulinaryStyle.label: Culinary Style
CulinaryStyle.explanation: The process described for assembling lasagna follows a traditional culinary style, emphasizing classic techniques and ingredients.

Step8.content: bake at a 200 degree Celsius oven for 15 minutes
Step8.label: Baking
Step8.step_assignment_explanation: After assembling the lasagna, this part instructs on baking the lasagna to complete the cooking process.
